implementations.structures

Class ScheduleImp

  • java.lang.Object
    • implementations.structures.ScheduleImp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Schedule

    public class ScheduleImp
extends java.lang.Object
implements Schedule
    This class represents the abstraction of a schedule (or a partial schedule) A schedule contains an ordered list of nodes together with an assigned core. (This is known as AlgorithmNode). Schedule also contains the starting time for each node, as well as the total running time for the entire schedule. (These time are computed and set using setters.) An object of this class should be returned when the time for a schedule (or a partial schedule) is calculated. The Schedule class is also responsible for computing the next schedule, given a new incoming node.
    Author:
    Victor

public ScheduleImp(java.util.List<AlgorithmNode> algNodes,
                                int numberOfCores)
        Deprecated. 
        This constructor complies with the old way of creating a scheudle (that is pass in all the algNodes generated as a "valid schedule") This is only used in old test cases, and should no longer be used in final code.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextSchedule

        public Schedule getNextSchedule(AlgorithmNode currentAlgNode)
        This method should take the current node that's being processed, and add it to the schedule. The method will return a new schedule with all the old info + the new current node. This is the method that gets called most frequently in the algorithm class.
        Specified by:
        getNextSchedule in interface Schedule
        Returns:

      • setStartTimeForNode

        public void setStartTimeForNode(int startTime,
                                int index)
        This method sets the start time for an algorithm node. If the index is equal to the size, in which case this is the first time a start time has been assigned to this object, it would add it to the List. Otherwise, an update is done.
        Specified by:
        setStartTimeForNode in interface Schedule
        index - --- The index should match the index for the List.

      • getTotalIdleTime

        public int getTotalIdleTime()
        This method gets the total idle time of all processors. The idle time is defined as: the difference between this processor's finish time to the schedule time.
        Specified by:
        getTotalIdleTime in interface Schedule
        Returns:
